Dear Ms. Prusa:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the
violations identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The
corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the
following:
• How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
• Specific time frames for each violation as to when the action steps will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact
me. In any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an
acceptable corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any
questions. In the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone
immediately, please contact the area manager at (616) 204-6992.

III. INVESTIGATION
Rule Code & CCI Rule 400.4158 Intervention standards and prohibitions.
Section (1) A child caring institution shall establish and follow written
Description policies and procedures that prohibit the following forms of
intervention:
(a) Any type of physical punishment including, but not
limited to:
(ii) Hitting or striking, throwing, kicking, pulling, or
pushing a youth on any part of their body.
Violation Potential Rule or Statute Violation
Type
Allegation During an altercation a staff member hit and bit a youth.
Investigation The complainant was interviewed on 04/25/2023 and had no
additional information to provide outside of what was originally
reported.
On 04/19/2023 Youth A was interviewed with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit at the facility. At the
beginning of the interview, Youth A failed to distinguish several
introductory questions from DHHS Worker 1, including making the
statement that he has been hiding chainsaws under his bed as an
example of a truth when distinguishing between truths and a lie.
Youth A stated that he could not remember which staff had hurt
him, but that during the incident in question the staff member had
dug her nails into his forearm. He stated that he had grabbed the
staff members glasses and was breaking them at that time. Youth
A stated this occurred near the fence behind his unit. Youth A
stated the staff member pushed her forearm into his neck,
pressing him up against the fence and punched him in the lip
during this altercation. Youth A remembered the staff member
attempted to kick him in his legs, but they missed. Youth A stated
this entire incident ended with the staff member “pretending” to try
to help him as they went back inside the side entrance of the
unit. Youth A reported the staff member pushed him to the ground
first before any of the other actions he described. Youth A
admitted to punching the staff member in the stomach during the
altercation. Youth A believed no one was watching and no other
staff or youth were around to have witnessed this interaction.
Youth A recalled the staff member stating she “could handle this
by herself” as the two of them first went outside. Youth A also
stated he felt like the female staff member pushed him in the chest
as they walked back inside. He reported the staff member has
never hurt him before. He described her with short hair, dyed
green hair, blue eyes that “turn green, and then red when she gets
2

angry.” Youth A stated several times he felt like the staff member
was very mean. When asked to describe his injuries from the
incident, Youth A stated he had a cut on his lip, but that it had
healed by the point in time of the interview. He also stated he had
cuts on his left forearm. Youth A stated he gets frequent skin
rashes that he sometimes itches until they bleed and is given a
cream every day for his forearms. Youth A stated he got three
black eyes from the incident, but no black eyes were visible during
the interview.
Later that same day, Youth A was re-interviewed with DHHS
Worker 1 and showed the location where the incident occurred.
Youth A reported he and Staff 1 had both come out of the back
door of the unit and this is where Staff 1 had pushed him against
the fence with her arm. Youth A then stated that he moved about
10 or 15 feet to his right side of the building and that is where he
broke her glasses. Youth A stated multiple times that she was
being “fake” with him when she attempted to let him inside. Youth
A stated that he was sitting on some cinder blocks that are located
in between his unit and the one next to it when Staff 5 came out to
see him. Youth A stated several times “this stuff happened for
real” and “she was way super mean to me.” Youth A stated Staff 5
was the first staff member other than Staff 1 he encountered after
the incident and Staff 5 took him to play basketball afterwards.
Youth A was interviewed on 05/17/2023 at a local child advocacy
center and this was able to be viewed over video. Youth A stated
he was able to distinguish between a truth and a lie and
understand if the interviewer was saying something incorrect by
responding with a story about how he had taught a professional
basketball player how to shoot the basketball just the other day.
He also stated “I’m not sure what is the truth” at one point during
the beginning of the interview. When asked to describe the
incident in question, Youth A stated Staff 1 had pushed him into
the fence, and she had locked him outside. Youth A confirmed he
had broken Staff 1 glasses during the incident. He stated Staff 1
had dug her nails into his arm. Youth A believed this all happened
about one or two months ago. He also stated Staff 1 scratched
him on the face. Youth A stated he initially was upset with Staff 1
because she followed him outside and he stated, “stop following
me.” He believed Staff 1 had pretended to call the police during
the incident. Youth A stated he was bleeding on his arm, and
Staff 5 had seen him bleeding after the incident. He stated Staff 1
also tried to kick him during the peak of the incident. Youth A
denied he had been bit.
3

Staff 1 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Staff 1
stated she has worked at the facility since October 2022 as a
direct care staff. Staff 1 stated she does not usually work in Youth
A’s unit but on the day in question she was asked to come over
and assist because several youths were struggling, and more staff
were needed. Staff 1 confirmed she was the staff member in
question that Youth A was referring to. Staff 1 stated around
dinner time, the facility’s Crisis Response Team was called
because Youth A had been struggling all day, including a fight with
Youth B. She recalled during this incident; Youth A was punched
in the eye by Youth B. Staff 1 stated the other staff that were
involved after the incident were Staff 2, Staff 4, and Staff 7. Staff
1 stated the beginning of this incident occurred when Youth A
stormed out of the unit and began to grab on doors and knock on
windows. Staff 1 believed he was trying to set off an alarm. Staff 1
stated she followed Youth A outside to maintain line of sight and
try to talk to him. She noted she had stayed arms reach away from
him. Staff 1 stated Youth A did not say much and turned around to
start attempting to hit her. She stated she blocked these attempts
with her forearms, and in the process reached in her pocket to
grab her cell phone, causing her glasses to fall off. Staff 1 stated
she remembered Staff 4 coming outside behind them at this point.
Staff 1 stated Youth A took her glasses from her hand and broke
them. Staff 1 stated she attempted to block the punches from
Youth A for about 45 seconds from start to finish. The whole
incident occurred near the back door of the unit. Staff 1 stated she
did not recall seeing Youth A fall by the door. Staff 1 stated she
called the Crisis Response Team number twice and both times it
went to voicemail, so she called Staff 2 for assistance, and he
answered his phone. Staff 1 denied shoving or pushing Youth A
during the incident. She stated she only used her forearm and was
blocking his punches. Staff 1 stated she never grabbed Youth A at
any point during the interaction. As they were walking back into
the unit, Youth A attempted to hit her again and she blocked his
arm once more. Staff 1 reiterated she never shoved Youth A and
she did not believe he made contact with the back fence at any
point during the interaction. She recalled when he made contact
with her and hit her in the face during one of his attempts, he was
close to the fence, though. Staff 1 believed there was not anyone
outside that could have seen this and the windows that look out to
that area are covered in a film that would not make it easy to see
what was occurring. Staff 1 did not know what might have caused
the cut on Youth A‘s lip. She denied punching Youth A in the face.
She stated she did not know an arm injury had occurred to Youth
A. Staff 1 stated she later heard Nurse 1 refer to a “prick” on
4

Youth A‘s arm. Staff 1 stated she did not believe she caused any
scratches or cuts to Youth A‘s arm during the incident because
she doesn’t have long fingernails. She stated she has been
trained to keep her hands off and open during an incident like this
in order to avoid having her hands closed in a fist and accidentally
hitting someone.
Staff 1 was interviewed again over the phone with DHHS Worker
1 on 05/02/2023. She stated she had been informed of all of the
allegations made by Youth A after the fact, but also stated she
had heard him say something to the same effect when they came
back inside the building. Staff 1 stated once the incident had
ended, and they came back inside the unit she attempted to stay
away from Youth A because of his escalated state. She stated she
had not seen any injuries on his arm or any injuries to his lip prior
to the incident in question. Staff 1 was asked more about any
possible physicality during the incident itself. She stated she had
only been trying to block any punches thrown by Youth A by
keeping her hands open and using her forearms. She stated
Youth A had hit her in the face, body, and stomach with punches
during the peak of the incident. This is when her glasses were
knocked off, and as she went to pick them up, he grabbed them
from her hand and kept them. She did not believe Youth A ever hit
her with his forearms themselves, but more like punches with his
hands. She believed when he was trying to kick her, it was
possible he had tripped or stumbled, but she was not 100% sure if
he ever fell to the ground. Staff 1 stated she had walked back into
the building alone with Staff 2 outside with Youth A. She stated
she could not see very well when she came in because she was
not wearing her glasses at the time. Staff 1 stated she did not
believe she did anything that could have caused Youth A‘s injuries
to his forearm or his lip during the accident.
Supervisor 1 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker
1 during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. She
stated she is a manager that generally works in a different unit
than Youth A. Supervisor 1 reported she was with Youth A when
he went to bed the night of the incident and he did not state
anything about being hit or harmed by Staff 1.
Staff 2 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit to the facility. He stated
he generally works in the same unit as Youth A. It has been Staff
2's experience that Youth A runs outside the side and back doors
of the unit when he gets escalated and upset, but this generally
does not turn into a more escalated situation. He has seen Youth
5

A punch walls and hit his own head on the wall. Staff 2 stated the
incident in question occurred during shift change and extended
into the night. Staff 2 stated Youth B and another youth that he
could not remember walked out of the unit behind Youth A but
quickly came inside. He remembered Staff 4 and Staff 5 coming in
to assist. Staff 2 stated he couldn’t see anything once Staff 1 and
Youth A went outside. He said they were outside for a few
minutes. Staff 2 saw Youth A and Staff 1 walking back toward the
side door and noticed Youth A had Staff 1 glasses, and Youth A
proceeded to snap them in half within Staff 2‘s view. Staff 2
couldn’t remember exactly what Youth A was saying other than
notable cursing towards Staff 1. Staff 2 stated Youth A and Staff 1
came right back inside next to each other. He recalled Staff 1 did
not have her hands on Youth A. After they came back inside,
Staff 2 stated Youth A was still escalated while in the unit,
including cussing and yelling. He recalled hearing Youth A say
that “she bit me.” Staff 2 believed Staff 5 took Youth A to the
nurses station. Staff 2 did not believe Youth A was bleeding when
he came inside. Staff 2 stated he was concerned about how
truthful Youth A was in that moment because there had been
concerns about similar statements being made in the past,
including that day when Youth A had stated he broke his arm
when playing basketball. Staff 2 stated he did not have any
concerns about Staff 1, as he has never seen her be physical, and
the older youth on the unit she generally worked had great
affection for her. Staff 2 reiterated he never saw Staff 1 touch or
assault Youth A. Staff 2 recalled prior to this specific part of the
incident Youth A had a pencil and had attempted to stab himself in
the arm as well as stab other staff. Staff 2 stated incidents like this
happen very frequently with Youth A. He reiterated that this is the
kind of incident where Youth A would attempt to self-harm, and in
the same action state staff were doing it to him.
Nurse 1 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated
she saw Youth A twice on the day in question. Once was because
he had been involved in a restraint the day prior, and that visit
produced no concerns. Later that evening, she saw Youth A and
provided a quick examination because he had a bruise on his
forearm that appeared to have a poke in it. She recalled it was
bleeding at the time. She cleaned the wound and asked him to
take a shower. Nurse 1 stated she asked Youth A to shower
because he has significant struggles with hygiene, and this greatly
exacerbates the rash and skin issues on his arms which he
commonly picks at. After the shower, she was planning on seeing
Youth A again to treat the wound and his irritated skin. Nurse 1
6

stated Staff 5 was with him, and she took photos of his arms, and
in doing so Youth A alleged he was bit by Staff 1. Nurse 1 stated
at first, she asked what had occurred and he stated that he “did
that outside” when referencing the injuries on his arm, but then a
minute later he stated that staff did that to his arm. Nurse 1 stated
there were no marks on Youth A‘s arm or lip that looked like a
bite, they looked more like bruising from a blunt force and a poke
that had severed the skin and caused it to bleed slightly. She
stated it looked fresh. Nurse 1 stated she works to ensure Youth A
gets ointment on breakouts that occur all over his body, most
commonly on his forearms. She stated it is used as needed, but
this comes up frequently. Nurse 1 recalled Youth A stated he had
a cut on his lip, and it was red but not bleeding at the time. Youth
A stated he had a run-in with staff. She stated she was not sure
what had actually occurred or not, and believed it was difficult to
tell just from comments made from Youth A. She stated she has
heard him allege different times in the past that staff have hurt him
when that did not appear to be true. Nurse 1 also stated there
have been times that Youth A has escalated to the point of
punching her while attempting to provide him treatment. The only
thing she could remember that Youth A said more specifically was
“she kept making it so that I can’t do stuff.”
Supervisor 2 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker
1 during an unannounced face-to-face visit at the facility. She
stated she often works in Youth A‘s unit and was working on the
day in question. Supervisor 2 stated she was off grounds with
another youth and returned about 8:30 PM. At this time the
physical part of the incident in question had already occurred.
Supervisor 2 stated she and Staff 6 woke Youth A up in order to
take him to the hospital to ensure that any possible injuries were
properly treated and examined. Supervisor 2 stated Supervisor 3
had made this decision. Youth A was asked about what happened
and said that the back of his foot hurt and “that’s where she kicked
me.” Supervisor 2 stated she took pictures of his foot, arms, lip
and face, around 10 PM. Supervisor 2 recalled Youth A stated that
his injury on his arm came from playing basketball earlier in the
day. Supervisor 2 also recalled Youth A stated that “she bit me
here” but could not specify which arm he was referring to when he
said this to her. Supervisor 2 stated she heard from other staff
Youth A stated something to the effect of being punched in his
face and that’s what caused his lip to bleed. She stated she heard
from Nurse 1 that he may have rubbed himself with a pencil or
stabbed himself with a pencil and that’s what might have caused
his forearm injuries. Supervisor 2 stated she had no prior
7

concerns with Staff 1 and noted she observed Staff 1 as cool,
calm, and collected after this incident occurred.
Staff 3 was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated
he was the assigned case manager for Youth A for about the last
two years. Staff 3 stated Youth A is playful, and then he often tries
to come off “bigger than he is.” Staff 3 stated Youth A often gets
into fights and altercations with other youth, and sometimes staff.
Staff 3 stated he believes Youth A has decent relationships with
many of the staff despite often lashing out at them. Staff 3 stated
Youth A has tried to hit him a few times during their time working
together, and he also tries to climb things when he is upset. Staff
3 stated he has not heard any statements about Staff 1 from
Youth A, despite having specifically talked about this incident.
Youth B was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced, face-to-face visit at the facility. Youth B
stated she had an incident earlier in the day on the day in question
with Youth A. She remembered him throwing a water bottle at her
and she attempted to throw a chair at him. Youth B stated this
occurred because Youth A thought she had “lied on him” to staff.
Youth B stated she had seen part of the alleged physical incident
with Youth A and Staff 1 outside the back of the unit because she
had the back door open. Youth B stated this is the only way to
have a clear view of this area unless you are looking through
some of the windows in the front of the unit, which cannot see all
the way to the back door. She stated she saw Staff 1 trying to
push Youth A off of her. Youth B stated the part of the incident she
saw involved Staff 1 not attempting to hit or harm Youth A, but
Youth A was the aggressor towards Staff 1. Youth B stated she
was not able to see anything further because a “code red” was
called, and that requires her to voluntarily go by her room, so she
does not accidentally become involved in the incident. She stated
the last thing she saw was Youth A going inside and throwing
trash cans around. Youth B stated she and Youth A have gotten
into several fights recently, including earlier on the day in question
when they both had punched each other in the head.
Youth C was interviewed on 04/19/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an unannounced face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated
she has seen Youth A escalate almost every day recently, and
this involved witnessing him attempting to hit Staff 1 and walk out
of the units. She stated he had thrown a water bottle at her head,
and she had hit him and pulled his hair in response. Youth C
stated she had heard Youth A claim Staff 1 bit and punched him in
8

the face. Youth C stated she has seen Youth A attempt to make
his nose bleed in the past in order for it to seem like he was hit by
someone else. During the incident in question, she was in her
room, and came out and saw Youth A escalated in the unit and
attempted to hit a female staff member which she couldn’t
remember which staff member. Youth C stated she saw Youth A
go outside and Staff 1 follow him. Youth C stated she did not see
what occurred outside after this point in time. Youth C expressed
Staff 1 is a good staff and she has never seen her be physical or
mean with any youth.
Staff 4 was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated he
was working in Youth A’s unit on the day of the alleged incident.
He stated he entered the unit from the hallway, and noticed
immediate commotion involving Youth A while he was still inside.
All Staff 4 could recall hearing was various youth stating they saw
Youth A break Staff 1’s glasses. Staff 4 said he went to the side
door and saw through the window Youth A holding the door and
Staff 1 standing behind him. Staff 4 stated he heard Youth A
yelling towards Staff 1 and cussing at her but could not recall
exactly what was being said at that point. Staff 4 stated he saw
Staff 1 nonverbally calling for help by waving towards other staff
that were inside. Staff 4 stated Youth A and Staff 1 came inside
from the side door of the unit and Staff 4 was concerned Youth A
was attempting to get to Staff 1 and hit her. Staff 4 recalled Youth
B approached the group at this point and was trying to punch
Youth A by swinging over Staff 2. Staff 4 stated Staff 2 backed up
away from Youth A and Youth B backed up with him. Staff 4
stated he could not tell for sure if Youth B made contact with
Youth A when she attempted to hit him, or where, but she was
punching towards Youth A’s head. Staff 4 stated he believed Staff
2 took Youth A willingly back outside and was not sure where they
went. Staff 4 stated he encountered Youth A about 30 or 45
minutes later and he heard Youth A stating Staff 1 had bit him.
Staff 4 stated he did not see any injuries or blood on Youth A and
did not hear where he may have been bit. Staff 4 stated he has
worked with Youth A a significant amount and has had concern on
Youth A’s quick ability to escalate and attempt to hit people as
well as his frequency of stating he is being hurt by a staff or youth
when that is not the case. Staff 4 stated he has worked with Staff
1 many times and he has never had a concern, noting that he has
seen Youth A seek her out for comfort on more than one occasion
in the past.
9

Staff 5/Complainant was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS
Worker 1 during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility.
She stated she is a behavioral specialist that works with Youth A‘s
unit and was the on-call Crisis Response Team member that
interacted with Youth A after the incident in question. She stated
she received a call involving Youth A as well as another youth that
evening. When she arrived Youth A was back on the unit and was
somewhat de-escalated from what she had been told. Youth A
was sitting on the couch in the unit and other youth were getting
ready for bed when she entered. Staff 5 stated she saw Youth A
throwing items at Staff 2 at that time. Staff 5 stated her job at that
point was to work towards managing the environment and trying to
convince Youth A to stop throwing things so she could speak with
him. Staff 5 stated she was able to convince Youth A to come with
her and they walked outside. Youth A was banging his hands on
room windows. Staff 5 recalled being able to talk Youth A into
going back inside and having to put her attention towards another
youth. She stated she heard Staff 2 say Youth A broke Staff 1’s
glasses and she saw Youth A and Staff 1 come inside from the
side door of the unit. Staff 5 recalled hearing Youth A state “she
bit me” several times over and showing a great deal of emotion.
She also heard Youth A say, “she hit my lip.” Staff 5 stated she
was able to see Youth A‘s arm and noted she witnessed two red
irritated lines and a small cut that looked like a pin prick on top.
Staff 5 stated she heard Youth A state, “she pushed me up to the
fence” and he pulled down his bottom lip and it appeared to be
bleeding slightly. Staff 5 stated he approached her further and
took a hug from her. Staff 5 stated she did not see any injuries to
Youth A prior to him being outside with Staff 1. Staff 5 stated she
took Youth A outside and they went around the back of the unit to
play football in an attempt to de-escalate. Youth A stated his arm
hurt and Staff 5 decided to take him to the nurse. She
remembered Staff 2 coming by and hearing Staff 2 state “no one
is going to believe you” in response to Youth A’s allegations. Staff
5 recalled Nurse 1 cleaned Youth A’s wound and had told him to
go shower. As Youth A showered, Staff 5 stayed to continue
working with him. After he showered and got dressed, Staff 5 took
him back to the nurse’s office so his cream could be applied to his
arm. Staff 5 stated she took Youth A back to his unit. Staff 5
stated Staff 6 came to the unit and took Youth A to urgent care to
be examined further. Staff 5 stated she has heard Youth A make
accusations like this before and she has had concerns about his
ability to recall specific people involved in situations as well as
time frames. Staff 5 stated she has only interacted with Staff 1 a
few times but had heard great things about her work with the
youth at the facility.
10

Staff 6 was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced, face-to-face visit at the facility. She stated
she had been working on call with the Crisis Response Team the
night of the incident in question. She stated the situation had
seemed to have calmed down by the time she got to the facility
around 8:50 PM. Youth A was in the unit and was in a reasonably
calm mood. She stated she heard from Staff 5 what happened.
Staff 6 stated she was the staff member who took Youth A to the
hospital to be examined further. Staff 6 stated Youth A initially told
the hospital staff that those scrapes on his arm were from playing
basketball earlier. Staff 6 remembered statements from the doctor
or the nurse to the effect of “you said earlier that you got bit”
toward Youth A and Youth A replying, “no, those are from
basketball.” Staff 6 corrected herself and stated the doctor had
originally asked what happened and one of the triage nurses
stated that his injuries did not look like a bite mark. Supervisor 2
noted prior to arriving at the hospital Youth A had told her he got
bit. She stated this occurred when she was taking pictures of
Youth A‘s arm injury and his lip injury. Staff 6 stated Youth A didn’t
need stitches for his lip, and they never advanced into the hospital
past triage in the waiting room. Staff 6 stated Youth A did not say
anything else about the incident on the way back home.
Supervisor 3 was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS Worker
1 during an announced face-to-face visit to the facility and she
stated that she is the Director of Children’s Services and was not
working a shift during the incident in question but was contacted
by Staff 5 and Staff 6 separately. She was informed by Staff 5
Youth A had made allegations of being hit and bit by Staff
1. Supervisor 3 stated it was her responsibility to make sure those
allegations were handled properly. Supervisor 3 stated she was
the one who called Administrator 1 and made the decision to have
Youth A sent into urgent care to be checked out even after the
facility nurse head examined him. Supervisor 3 stated she was a
case manager in a previous position with the facility and was
Youth A‘s case manager. She stated she could not recall him
making any specific allegations against staff members before.
Supervisor 3 stated she experienced Youth A struggling with the
concept of truth and liking to exaggerate, quoting him as stating
one time in the past “remember when I was Spider-Man?”
Staff 7 was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit at the facility. He stated he
was working the night of the incident in question. Staff 7 stated he
witnessed Youth A go outside the side door of the unit to have
11

Staff 1 follow him to shadow and provide line of sight. He stated
he did not witness what happened outside, but only a minute or so
later he heard tapping at the side door and saw Youth A at the
door, holding a pair of glasses and tapping them on the
window. The door was opened, and Youth A came in first with
Staff 1 following behind him. Staff 7 did not recall Youth A saying
anything specific outside of cussing and yelling at Staff 1 during
this time. He did not believe Staff 1 was saying anything back to
Youth A. Staff 7 reported Youth B came up to those that were
standing near Youth A and tried to hit him, but he was not sure if
she connected on her attempt. Staff 7 stated he and Staff 2 were
in between Youth B and Youth A during this part of the incident
and as soon as she attempted to hit him, she backed up and
walked away. Staff 7 stated the whole situation de-escalated once
Staff 5 arrived to provide one on one supervision and support to
Youth A. Staff 7 recalled hearing Youth A say random comments
such as “yeah, broke your glasses you stupid bitch” directed
toward Staff 1. He also recalled hearing Youth A state “the bitch
punched me in my nose and mouth at the same time.” Staff 7
stated he did not see any injuries and he had a good enough view
of Youth A during the minutes that followed him coming back
inside to see so. Staff 7 recalled Staff 1 being on the phone with
another supervisor in the immediate aftermath and he was certain
she did not have much or any contact with Youth A after that point
in time for the rest of the night.
Youth D was interviewed on 04/25/2023 with DHHS Worker 1
during an announced face-to-face visit to the facility. She stated
during her time placed at the facility she remembered Youth A
being in many incidents with other youth and staff where he
attempted to hit them, including herself. Youth D stated she was in
the unit when the incident in question happened and saw Youth A
and Staff 1 come back inside. She recalled hearing Youth A state
over and over he had been hit and bit by Staff 1. She also heard
Youth A state he grabbed Staff 1 glasses and had broken them.
Youth D believed she saw a bruise on Youth A's arm that was
greenish in color. Youth D stated she sees marks and scratches
on Youth A’s arm frequently because he often scratches them and
uses items like pencils to attempt to self-harm on his wrists and
forearms. She did not believe she saw him bleeding. Youth D
confirmed she did not see Youth A and Staff 1 outside during the
interaction itself. She stated she has not seen any staff escalate to
the point of hitting or pushing youth during her time at the facility,
despite youth attempting to do so back to them.

Documentation reviewed:
• Documentation received from the facility noted that a safety
plan was put in place the day after the incident in question
outlining that Staff 1 was put on administrative leave as a
result of these allegations and was not allowed to have
further contact with any children placed at the facility.
• Documentation received from the facility noted that as of
05/04/2023 Staff 1’s employment with the facility had
ended. This termination occurred during the employee’s
probationary period for performance related issues. Staff A
had also been on administrative leave since the incident
occurred on 04/15/2023.
• 04/15/2023 Incident Report authored by Staff 1. This report
described the incident similar to interviews provided by
Staff 1. In it she notes Youth A hit several staff and youth
that were unnamed and hit her in the body and the face,
then breaking her glasses. Staff 1 stated she attempted
directive statements and time away to attempt to help and
she then traded out with another staff when they arrived.
She also noted the allegations made by Youth A that Staff
1 bit her.
• Pictures taken on 04/15/2023 of Youth A’s injuries were
provided by the facility. They show a bruised inner part of
his bottom lip and what appear to be scrapes on his right
forearm.
• Video was reviewed from 04/15/2023. This camera view is
located inside the unit and shows the entire living room and
dining area, as well as facing the side door with a contained
window. There is no video footage that captures any area
past the side door to the unit, so the incident that occurred
between Youth A and Staff 1 outside and toward the back
of the unit was not captured.
• At approximately 7:56 PM video footage shows Staff 2
pushed Youth A out of the side door of the unit and
closes the door behind Youth A once he is outside.
This camera view is located near the front door to the
unit and faces past the kitchenette area towards the
dining table and living room area of the unit. This
occurred after several minutes of Youth A showing
dysregulated behaviors inside the unit.
• At approximately 7:59 PM video footage shows Youth
A approached the closed side door to the unit from the
outside. He was followed by Staff 1. Staff 4
approached the door from the inside appearing to see
Youth A and Staff 1 outside of it. Before Staff 4 gets to
the door, it opened from the outside. Staff 1 opened
13

the door towards her as Youth A began to walk through
the doorway. Staff 1 pushed Youth A from the back as
he walked in, and Youth A reached back to attempt to
hit her in retaliation. As they stepped inside Youth A
then attempted to shove Staff 1, and they both
attempted to push off of each other. Staff 1 walked
away from Youth A.
• Medical documentation from McLaren Flint dated
04/16/2023 was provided. This documentation outlines the
medical attention Youth A received in the morning after the
incident. In this report it states Youth A reported he was
punched in the lip and then pushed down. Youth A had
superficial scratches on his left forearm as well as a mild
cut on the inside of his lower lip without active bleeding.
• Physical Intervention Policy last updated 08/19/2022 from
the facility was provided and reviewed. In this policy
language from CCI Rule 400.4158 is quoted, including
400.4158 (1) (a) (ii) describing prohibited acts of hitting,
pushing, or kicking youth.
Analysis Through interviews with staff and youth, video review and
documentation there was sufficient evidence to show Youth A had
been pushed on more than one occasion during the entirety of the
04/15/2023 incident by Staff 1 and Staff 2. There was not
conclusive evidence found that Staff 1 pushed, kicked, bit or hit
Youth A during the outside portion of the incident in question as
Youth A’s accounts changed, Staff 1 denied, and there were no
witnesses.
Consultation provided:
In discussions with administration, consultation was provided on
staff utilizing proximity to attempt to avoid engaging physically with
a youth that does not require a restraint intervention while still
providing proper line of sight. In addition, the Crisis Response
Team and its timeliness and proper messaging among facility staff
was discussed.
